sentences.english: This fable criticizes those ignorant and arrogant people.
sentences.chinese: 这则寓言讽刺了那些孤陋寡闻，又盲目自大的人。

sentences.english: Were our ancestors lucky to be only partly informed?
sentences.chinese: 我们的祖先孤陋寡闻是否算幸运呢？

sentences.english: Scientists actually know little about how animals perform their navigational feats.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们对动物的这种导航绝技却是孤陋寡闻的。

sentences.english: Forgive my ignorance , but what exactly are you talking about?
sentences.chinese: 请原谅我的孤陋寡闻，你说的到底是什么？

sentences.english: We are all too ignorant to hear of such a term before.
sentences.chinese: 是我们都太孤陋寡闻，竟然没听说过激情杀人。

sentences.english: If you live in the country, you soon get out of touch with things.
sentences.chinese: 如果你住在乡下，你很快会变得孤陋寡闻。

definition: lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
the frog at the bottom of the well (idiom)/fig. a person of limited outlook and experience
lit. to view the sky from the bottom of a well (idiom); ignorant and narrow-minded
your name has been known to me for a long time (polite)
to mock/to be ridiculed/to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)
lit. like thunder piercing the ear/a well-known reputation (idiom)
the name does not reflect the reality (idiom); more in name than in fact/Reality does not live up to the name./Excellent theory, but the practice does not bear it out.
